humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from " shell ", "弍" sound ("弍" from "弋" sound), with the ancient currency " shell " as the symbol, the original meaning is the number two.

Bronze inscriptions may start with "戌", "戌" resembles the shape of an axe, and it is the same weapon as " Ge ", so it can be used as a radical. And " Yi " and " Ge " as radicals are often confused because of their similarity. "Shuowen": "Two, Fu, Yiye. Congbei, 弍声. 弍, ancient text two."

" Two " is formed by adding " two " to the word " bonito ", so Zhang Shichao believes that " two " is derived from " bonito ". The variants in the bronze inscriptions are also derived from " Ge " from " Second " from " flesh ".

Bronze inscription means number two, 琱生簋: "The public suspends their participation, and the female (ru) suspends the second." " Dang " is pronounced " degree ", which means possession, meaning that the public has three shares and you have two shares. (Wang Zhankui, Lin Yuan). It was also extended to be non-specific and dissimilar. Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "No one's heart."

In addition, " two " is the number of two, which can also be used as a verb to explain "repetition", as in "The Analects of Confucius-Yong Ye": "Those who have a beautiful face are eager to learn, do not irritate, and do not pass."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from " Bei ", "弍" sound ("弍" from "弋" sound), with the meaning of the ancient currency " shell ", the original meaning is the number two.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「貝」，「弍」聲(「弍」從「弋」聲)，以古貨幣「貝」為意符，本義是數字二。

　　金文或從「戌」，「戌」象斧鉞之形，與「戈」同為武器，故作為偏旁可通用。而「弋」、「戈」作為偏旁往往因形近而相混。《說文》：「貳，副、益也。从貝，弍聲。弍，古文二。」

　　「貳」是「貣」字加「二」而成，故張世超認為「貳」是自「貣」孳乳而成。金文中的異體還有從「戈」從「二」從「肉」。

　　金文表示數詞二，琱生簋：「公宕其參，女(汝)則宕其貳。」「宕」讀為「度」，表示占有，意思是說公占有三份，你占有兩份(王占奎、林澐)。又引申為不專一，有異心，中山王方壺：「不貳其心。」

　　此外，「貳」為二之數，又可用作動詞解作「重複」，如《論語‧雍也》：「有顏回者好學，不遷怒，不貳過」。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「貝」，「弍」聲(「弍」從「弋」聲)，以古貨幣「貝」為意符，本義是數字二。

金文從「 貝 」，「 弍 」聲(「 弍 」從「 弋 」聲)，以古貨幣「 貝 」為意符，本義是數字二。 金文或從「 戌 」，「 戌 」象斧鉞之形，與「 戈 」同為武器，故作為偏旁可通用。而「 弋 」、「 戈 」作為偏旁往往因形近而相混。《說文》：「貳，副、益也。从貝，弍聲。弍，古文二。」 「 貳 」是「 貣 」字加「 二 」而成，故張世超認為「 貳 」是自「 貣 」孳乳而成。金文中的異體還有從「 戈 」從「 二 」從「 肉 」。 金文表示數詞二，琱生簋：「公宕其參，女(汝)則宕其貳。」「 宕 」讀為「 度 」，表示占有，意思是說公占有三份，你占有兩份(王占奎、林澐)。又引申為不專一，有異心，中山王方壺：「不貳其心。」 此外，「 貳 」為二之數，又可用作動詞解作「重複」，如《論語‧雍也》：「有顏回者好學，不遷怒，不貳過」。
Bronze inscription from " shell", " 弍" sound (" 弍" from " 弋" sound), with the ancient currency " shell" as the symbol, the original meaning is the number two. Bronze inscriptions may start with " 戌", " 戌" resembles the shape of an axe, and it is the same weapon as " Ge", so it can be used as a radical. And " Yi" and " Ge" as radicals are often confused because of their similarity. "Shuowen": "Two, Fu, Yiye. Congbei, 弍声. 弍, ancient text two." " Two" is formed by adding " two" to the word " bonito", so Zhang Shichao believes that " two" is derived from " bonito". The variants in the bronze inscriptions are also derived from " Ge" from " Second" from " flesh". Bronze inscription means number two, 琱生簋: "The public suspends their participation, and the female (ru) suspends the second." " Dang" is pronounced " degree", which means possession, meaning that the public has three shares and you have two shares. (Wang Zhankui, Lin Yuan). It was also extended to be non-specific and dissimilar. Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "No one's heart." In addition, " two" is the number of two, which can also be used as a verb to explain "repetition", as in "The Analects of Confucius-Yong Ye": "Those who have a beautiful face are eager to learn, do not irritate, and do not pass."

貳字的基本解释

貳
èr
见“贰”。

貳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［èr］
［《廣韻》而至切，去至，日。］
“贰1”的繁体字。亦作“貮1”。
(1)副手；副职。
(2)辅佐。
(3)增益；增添。
(4)复制副本。
(5)指副本。
(6)数词。“二”的大写。
(7)再次，重复。
(8)匹敌；比并。
(9)不信任；怀疑。
(10)不专一；怀有二心。
(11)离异；分裂。
(12)违背；背叛。
(13)指叛逆者。
(14)变易；变化。
(15)犹业。事务。
(16)通“膩”。污秽。
(17)通“忒”。
(18)古国名。故地在今湖北省广水市境。
(19)姓。北魏有貳尘。见《晋书·姚兴载记上》。

貳字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　貳； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1206第14
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?而至切，音樲。【說文】副益也。【書·周官】貳公弘化。【傳】副貳三公。【周禮·天官·小宰】掌邦之六典、八灋、八則之貳。【註】貳，副也。【禮·少儀】乗貳車則式。【註】貳車，副車。　又與二同。【易·坎卦】樽酒簋貳。【註】一樽之酒，二簋之食。【禮·曲禮】雖貳不辭。【註】貳，謂重殽膳也。又【坊記】惟卜之日稱二君。【註】二，當爲貳　又【爾雅·釋詁】貳，疑也。【疏】貳者，心疑不一也。【書·大禹謨】任賢勿貳。【詩·大雅】無貳爾心。【左傳·閔元年】閒攜貳。【註】離而相疑者，則當因而閒之。　又【左傳·隱元年】旣而大叔命西鄙北鄙貳於己。【註】鄙，鄭邊邑。貳，兩屬也。　又【左傳·隱二年】王貳于虢。【註】王欲分政於虢。　又【玉篇】代也，敵也，?也。　又姓。【廣韻】《後秦錄》有後魏平陽太守貳塵。

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [èr]
["Guangyun" and to cut, go to, day. ]
"贰1" in traditional characters. Also known as "Dace 1".
(1) Deputy; deputy.
(2) Assistant.
(3) Gain; increase.
(4) Duplicate copy.
(5) Refers to copies.
(6) Numerals. The capital of "two".
(7) Again, repeat.
(8) Rivalry; Comparing.
(9) Distrust; doubt.
(10) Not single-minded; double-minded.
(11) Divorce; split.
(12) Violation; betrayal.
(13) Refers to rebels.
(14) Change; change.
(15) Youye. Affairs.
(16) Through "greasy". filthy.
(17) Through "忒".
(18) Ancient country name. The old place was in the border of Guangshui City, Hubei Province.
(19) Last name. There are two dusts in the Northern Wei Dynasty. See "Book of Jin·Yao Xing Zai".
